Professor.title: Professor
Professor.description: Represents a professor within the UNDB system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Professor entity.

registrationDate.description: The date the professor registered in the system.

course.description: The course the professor is associated with (e.g., 'Arquitetura e Urbanismo').

Course.title: Course
Course.description: Represents a course offered at UNDB.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Course entity.

thematicTree.description: The thematic tree of the course.

bibliography.description: The bibliography of the course, separated into sections.

Classroom.title: Classroom
Classroom.description: Represents a specific class group for a course.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Classroom entity.

name.description: The name of the classroom (e.g., Class A).

semester.description: The semester the classroom is active in.

workload.description: The workload of the course for this specific classroom.

classType.description: The type of class (e.g., Regular, Intensive).

gradingRule.description: The grading rules for the classroom.

Student.title: Student
Student.description: Represents a student enrolled at UNDB.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Student entity.

ClassroomStudent.title: ClassroomStudent
ClassroomStudent.description: Represents the association between a classroom and a student (many-to-many relationship).

id.description: Unique identifier for the ClassroomStudent entity.

groupId.description: Reference to the Group this student belongs to. (Relationship: Group 1:N ClassroomStudent)

grades.description: An array of grades for the student in this classroom.

Group.title: Group
Group.description: Represents a group of students within a classroom.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Group entity.

Document.title: Document
Document.description: Represents a document stored within the system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Document entity.

courseId.description: Reference to Course. Can be null if the document is not associated with a specific course.

fileUrl.description: The URL where the document is stored.

documentType.description: The type of the document (e.g., uploaded file or external link).

fileType.description: The MIME type of the uploaded file (e.g., 'application/pdf').

fileName.description: The original name of the uploaded file.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the document was created.

AcademicEvent.title: AcademicEvent
AcademicEvent.description: Represents an event in the academic calendar.

id.description: Unique identifier for the AcademicEvent entity.

courseId.description: Reference to Course. (Relationship: Course 1:N AcademicEvent). Can be null if the event is not associated with a specific course.

name.description: The name of the event (e.g., Midterm Exam).

dateTime.description: The date and time of the event.

Idea.title: Idea
Idea.description: Represents an idea proposed in the 'Clube das Ideias'.

IdeaSupport.title: IdeaSupport
IdeaSupport.description: Represents a user's support for an idea.

CommunityEvent.title: CommunityEvent
CommunityEvent.description: An event in the community timeline.

Celebration.title: Celebration
Celebration.description: A celebration of a milestone or achievement.

ForumThread.title: ForumThread
ForumThread.description: A thread in the 'Caf√© das Ideias' forum.

ForumReply.title: ForumReply
ForumReply.description: A reply to a forum thread.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to support the UNDB ProfAssist application, focusing on secure access, efficient data management, and AI integration for lesson plan imports. Authorization Independence is achieved by structuring professor-owned data under their respective user IDs and by denormalizing the 'professorId' into subcollections where professor authorization is required. This eliminates the need for `get()` calls in security rules, enabling atomic operations. QAPs (Rules are not Filters) are supported through structural segregation and dedicated collections. User roles are implicitly managed via path-based ownership, and course/classroom associations are secured by including the relevant professorId in each document. The structure supports secure list operations by scoping data to specific professor's or courses. Explicit state modeling would be incorporated into fields like status to improve the clarity and maintainability. This design ensures that each collection maintains a homogeneous security posture, simplifying rules and enhancing debuggability. Added collections for the Community module, with public read access for authenticated professors and ownership-based write access.
